legalStatus.loanTypeAllowed: Title Loans (Regulated under California Financing Law)
legalStatus.restrictions: Subject to California Financing Law (CFL); APR capped at 30% for loans over $2,500; Minimum loan amount of $2,500 for title loans
legalStatus.notes: California allows title loans but with strict consumer protections. The DFPI is one of the nation's most active consumer protection regulators. Loans under $2,500 are subject to tiered rate caps.

regulations.maxLoanAmount: No statutory maximum (based on vehicle fair market value)
regulations.minLoanAmount: $2,500 (for simplified rate structure); smaller loans subject to tiered rates
regulations.maxAPR: 30% per annum for loans of $2,500 or more
regulations.interestCalculation: Simple interest on unpaid principal balance

fees.prepaymentPenalty: Prohibited - borrowers may prepay at any time without penalty (Section 22307.5)
fees.repossessionFees: Actual fees up to $500 to licensed repossession agencies
fees.otherFees: All fees must be clearly disclosed and included in APR calculation

licensing.regulatoryBody: California Department of Financial Protection and Innovation (DFPI)

rightToRescind.notes: California does not mandate a rescission period for title loans

requiredDisclosures: Total cost of loan in dollars and as Annual Percentage Rate (APR)
Complete payment schedule with all fees itemized
Consequences of default including repossession rights
DFPI license number and contact information
Right to prepay without penalty at any time
All charges and fees before signing
prohibitedPractices: Charging more than 30% APR on loans $2,500 or more
Making loans under $2,500 at higher than tiered rates
Unfair, deceptive, or abusive acts or practices (UDAAP)

collectionRules.deficiencyBalance: May pursue deficiency judgment per loan agreement

cityPageContent.headline: Understanding Title Loan Laws in California
cityPageContent.intro: Residents of {{city}} benefit from California's strong consumer protection laws enforced by the Department of Financial Protection and Innovation (DFPI), one of the nation's most active consumer protection regulators.
keyPoints: California caps title loan interest at 30% APR for loans of $2,500 or more
Minimum loan amount for standard title loans is $2,500
All lenders must be licensed by the DFPI - verify at dfpi.ca.gov/verify-a-license
No prepayment penalties allowed - you can pay off early at any time
Lenders must provide clear disclosure of all costs before you sign
You have the right to file complaints with DFPI at (866) 275-2677
cityPageContent.disclaimer: This information is for general educational purposes only and may not reflect the most current legal developments. Laws and regulations change frequently. Always consult with a licensed attorney or contact the California DFPI at (866) 275-2677 or visit dfpi.ca.gov for the most accurate and up-to-date information before making any financial decisions.
